feed.title: TOTW
feed.subtitle: Trees of the world, A site for learning about trees in different continents.

entry.title: Welcome to Trees of the World

link.title: Welcome to Trees of the World

entry.content:
Welcome to TOTW. My goal for this blog is to research and discover trees from around the world. My goal is to release a series of blog posts weekly that will bring you BIG, small, interesting, or rare trees from around the world. I plan to provide you with a breif description of:

  • Their location.
  • Their prefered habitat.
  • An interesting fact about the tree and/or region.
  • The trees use, whether it be medicinal, construction, or some other resource.

Join me on this adventure, and discover Trees of the world!

_Further Reading Trees of Australia - Wikipedia

The trees use, whether it be medicinal, construction, or some other resource. Join me on this adventure, and discover Trees of the world! _Further Reading Trees of Australia - Wikipedia

entry.title: A begginers WebDev experience
entry.content: I know here at TOTW we are focused on learning and researching about trees from around the world but this all began as a hobby to learn the skills of web development. As that is the case, I’d like to share a little bit about how the website what built, it’s foundations and beginings. Origionally I was planing on building this website with a CSS framework, in particular Bulma CSS. Using the Bulma framework, I was able to create very beautiful, repsonsive desktop and mobile compatible website. The learning curve was steep, as before this I had zero knowledge of HTML and CSS. As I have not
